new tool aside from some other tools
that came out this week. But anyway, the
time warp curve gives you the ability to
when you put it in the sequencer, it
gives you this timeline. And the
timeline represents one from the
beginning of your track or your shot to
the end. So you can select that and bake
it. And so once you bake it, you can say
I'm going to bake it on fours or I'm
going to bake it on threes. And then it
creates this huge
stepped. Well, you have to set the
stepping to constant instead of linear
like the slide shows. But that means
it's going to hold whatever animation's
happening on that frame for those next
three frames. And then it's going to
skip three frames ahead and hold that.
And and it's a non-destructive way to
get stylized stepped animation. And you
can put different steps on all sorts of
things. And when I say non-destructive,
what I mean is it's better than just
baking out your character animation and
then having to go back and and maybe do
something to get it back if you wanted
to change it. This way you can change it
to multiple steps, decide what's best
for your project, and move on.
